<%GTREE 2.4.13 Rules governing metadata and their relationships%>
VocabularyElementDescription.VocabularyElementDescription: Rules governing metadata and their relationships

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A categorical descriptor of the status of something, e.g., the status of an entity in a process, or the status of a process itself.
The status of a resource in its lifecycle.

VocabularyElementDescription.AttributeDescription: name of the data dictionary metadata field

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

VocabularyElementDescription.AttributeDescription: description of the data dictionary metadata field

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

VocabularyElementDescription.AttributeDescription: datatypes used in the data dictionary metadata fields

\\.ControlledVocabularyItemDescription: For general textual data, including simple character strings.

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A string of characters.

\\.ControlledVocabularyItemDescription: For more substantial amounts of alphanumeric characters or longer text.

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: Data that primarily includes sequences of characters.

\\.ControlledVocabularyItemDescription: For properties with an array of properties as values.

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: An object composed of multiple other objects.

\\.ControlledVocabularyItemDescription: For date values used in properties like version date.

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A particular day, month, or year.

\\.ControlledVocabularyItemDescription: For properties with URL or URI values.

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A Uniform Resource Identifier reference data type.

\\.ControlledVocabularyItemDescription: For properties with values that are items in a controlled vocabulary, enumeration, or list.

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A collection of standardized terms and their meanings that are used to provide consistent labeling and descriptions of concepts within a domain.

\\.ControlledVocabularyItemDescription: a form of data with only two possible values ( 'true' and 'false')

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A data type that has one of two possible values (usually denoted true and false) which represent logic values.

\\.ControlledVocabularyItemDescription: For properties with email address values.

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A string that represents the email address of a person or organization.

The datatype xsd:integer represents an arbitrarily large mathematical integer. An xsd:integer is a sequence of decimal digits, optionally preceded by a + or - sign. Leading zeros are permitted, but decimal points are not.
A built-in data type in the XML Schema definition language used for defining simple type elements that represent single-precision 32-bit floating point numbers.

\\.ControlledVocabularyItemDescription: specific text type, namely hyper text markup language

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: An indication of the form that a value will have.
A category of information, indicating the nature or characteristics of the content of a resource.

\\.AttributeDescription: see OIMS self describing metadata schema

ControlledVocabulary.VocabularyElementDescription: If the metadata field is required at all times

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: An indication as to whether entity is mandatory

ControlledVocabulary.VocabularyElementDescription: If the metadata field is recommended but not strictly required

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: Suggested as appropriate or suitable, but not strictly required
A requirement that is mandatory only under certain conditions or circumstances
A recommendation that is appropriate or suitable only under certain conditions or circumstances

ControlledVocabulary.VocabularyElementDescription: metadata field can be used if the information is available

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: possible but not necessary; left to choice
The degree to which a metadata attribute is required or recommended.

\\.AttributeDescription: if the attribute is compound or primitive

ControlledVocabulary.ControlledVocabularyItemDescription: the attribute does not have underlying attributes

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A basic or simple type that does not have underlying attributes
A type that has underlying attributes
A class of data item that is intended to capture the general category of the data item
A class that characterizes a set of entities that have common properties

\\.AttributeDescription: can the attribute have multiple values

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A related resource that is included either physically or logically in the described resource.

\\.AttributeDescription: Controlled Vocabulary definition if data type is Controlled Vocabulary also known as an enumeration in STATA or a factor in R

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A set of terms that are selected and defined based on the requirements set out by the user group, usually a set of vocabulary is chosen to promote consistency across data collection projects.

\\.AttributeDescription: the element identifier in a Controlled Vocabulary

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A term or label used in a controlled vocabulary

\\.AttributeDescription: the description of an element in a Controlled Vocabulary in human-intelligible terms

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A definition of a term in a controlled vocabulary

\\.AttributeDescription: details of the DataType compound used to identify the required attributes in an attribute array

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A group of related entities or concepts, including lists of attributes that describe those entities or concepts.

\\.AttributeDescription: Tagging atributes with ontology terms

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A digital resource that defines and describes a set of terms and relationships used to represent a domain of knowledge.

\\.AttributeDescription: Term in an ontology that describes the relevant attribute value

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A term in an ontology that represents a concept or entity in a particular domain.

\\.AttributeDescription: Description of the ontology term
The name of the ontology from which we take the ontology term

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: The name of an ontology or controlled vocabulary that provides a set of terms and relationships for describing entities in a specific domain.

\\.AttributeDescription: the identifier for the ontology term in the specified ontology
persistent URL where the ontology term can be found
identifies to what degree the ontology term matches the attribute value

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A term that describes the degree to which an ontology term matches the attribute value.

ControlledVocabulary.VocabularyElementDescription: The ontology term matches the attribute exactly

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A mapping relationship that specifies that two concepts are equivalent, i.e. have the same meaning.

ControlledVocabulary.VocabularyElementDescription: The ontology term covers the attribute, but the attribute is more specific than the ontology term

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A mapping relationship that specifies that one concept (the source concept) is broader than another concept (the target concept).

ControlledVocabulary.VocabularyElementDescription: The ontology term covers only part of the attribute, the attribute is broader than the ontology term

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A mapping relationship that specifies that one concept (the source concept) is narrower than another concept (the target concept).

ControlledVocabulary.VocabularyElementDescription: The ontology term partially matches the attribute value

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A mapping relationship that specifies that two concepts are sufficiently similar that they can be used interchangeably in some information retrieval applications.

ControlledVocabulary.VocabularyElementDescription: The ontology term is related to the attribute value, but not an exact match

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A mapping relationship that specifies that two concepts have some degree of association, but the nature of the relationship is not known or specified.

ControlledVocabulary.VocabularyElementDescription: The ontology term does not match the attribute value

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: The negation of the exact match relationship, indicating that two concepts are not equivalent or interchangeable.

ControlledVocabulary.VocabularyElementDescription: The ontology term needs to be confirmed by an ontology expert

\\.AttributeDescription: default value of the attribute if not set in the metadata

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: The value of a parameter that is used when no other value is specified.

\\.AttributeDescription: reserved words that have a special meaning in the contexr of the attribute and are not covered by Controlled Vocabulary
reserved words that have a special meaning in the context of the attribute and are not covered by Controlled Vocabulary
definition of reserved words that have a special meaning in the contexr of the attribute and are not covered by Controlled Vocabulary
comparable to AttributeValueElements but less restrictive
list of allowed content
rule how to manage the list of allowed content
specifics about rule how to manage the list of allowed content

OIMS_Content_Object_Properties.AttributeDescription: metadata schema(s) of this metadata schema

intermediate description between the apex metadata schema description and the self-describing metadata schema of OIMS

ValueReservedWords.ReservedWordDescription: all attributes in the OIMS_content part of the schema
none of attributes in the OIMS_content part of the schema

ValueReservedWords.ReservedWordDescription: all attributes in the OIMS_content part of the schema
none of attributes in the OIMS_content part of the schema

specific property that is a reserved word in JSON Schema

ControlledVocabulary.ControlledVocabularyItemDescription: In a JSON schema, a $ref keyword is a JSON Pointer to a schema, or a type or property in a schema. A JSON pointer takes the form of A # B in which: A is the relative path from the current schema to a target schema. If A is empty, the reference is to a type or property in the same schema, an in-schema reference.
